intro: Linanthus lemmonii, commonly known as the Lemmon's linanthus, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the evening primrose family (Onagraceae) and is characterized by its showy, yellow-orange flowers that bloom in the summer. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments, such as deserts and rocky soils, and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. It has slender, branching stems and small, lance-shaped leaves. Linanthus lemmonii is often found in open habitats and plays a role in supporting local pollinators.
